node.description: Retrieves and analyzes comments from YouTube videos.

include_metrics.info: Include metrics like like count and reply count.
include_metrics.name: include_metrics

include_replies.info: Whether to include replies to comments.
include_replies.name: include_replies

max_results.info: The maximum number of comments to return.
max_results.name: max_results

sort_by.info: Sort comments by time or relevance.
sort_by.name: sort_by

video_url.info: The URL of the YouTube video to get comments from.
video_url.name: video_url

node.description: Define the agent's instructions, then enter a task to complete using tools.

add_current_date_tool.info: If true, will add a tool to the agent that returns the current date.
add_current_date_tool.name: add_current_date_tool

agent_description.info: The description of the agent. This is only used when in Tool Mode. Defaults to 'A helpful assistant with access to the following tools:' and tools are added dynamically. This feature is deprecated and will be removed in future versions.
agent_description.name: agent_description
agent_description.value: A helpful assistant with access to the following tools:

context_id.info: The context ID of the chat. Adds an extra layer to the local memory.
context_id.name: context_id

format_instructions.info: Generic Template for structured output formatting. Valid only with Structured response.
format_instructions.name: format_instructions
format_instructions.value: You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format.

handle_parsing_errors.info: Should the Agent fix errors when reading user input for better processing?
handle_parsing_errors.name: handle_parsing_errors

input_value.info: The input provided by the user for the agent to process.
input_value.name: input_value

max_iterations.info: The maximum number of attempts the agent can make to complete its task before it stops.
max_iterations.name: max_iterations

n_messages.info: Number of chat history messages to retrieve.
n_messages.name: n_messages

output_schema.info: Schema Validation: Define the structure and data types for structured output. No validation if no output schema.
output_schema.name: output_schema

table_schema.description: Specify the name of the output field.
table_schema.name: name

table_schema.description: Describe the purpose of the output field.
table_schema.name: description

table_schema.description: Indicate the data type of the output field (e.g., str, int, float, bool, dict).
table_schema.name: type

table_schema.description: Set to True if this output field should be a list of the specified type.
table_schema.name: multiple

system_prompt.info: System Prompt: Initial instructions and context provided to guide the agent's behavior.
system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value: You are a helpful assistant that can use tools to answer questions and perform tasks.

tools.info: These are the tools that the agent can use to help with tasks.
tools.name: tools

node.description:
# 📖 README
This flow performs comprehensive analysis of YouTube videos.
1.  Extract video comments and transcripts.
2.  Run sentiment analysis on comments using LLM.
3.  Combine transcript content and comment sentiment for comprehensive video analysis.
## Quickstart
-  Add your **OpenAI API Key** to the **Language Model** and **YT-Insight** Agent Component
-  Add your **YouTube Data API v3 key**
- If you don't have a YoutTube API key, create one in the [Google Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com).
- Ensure the chat input is a valid YouTube video URL. A sample URL is provided in the chat input component.
Format a DataFrame or Data object into text using a template. Enable 'Stringify' to convert input into a readable string instead.

input_data.info: Accepts either a DataFrame or a Data object.
input_data.name: input_data

mode.info: Convert into raw string instead of using a template.
mode.name: mode

pattern.info: Use variables within curly brackets to extract column values for DataFrames or key values for Data.For example: `Name: {Name}, Age: {Age}, Country: {Country}`
pattern.name: pattern

node.description: Get chat inputs from the Playground.

context_id.info: The context ID of the chat. Adds an extra layer to the local memory.
context_id.name: context_id

files.info: Files to be sent with the message.
files.name: files

input_value.info: Message to be passed as input.
input_value.name: input_value

session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.
session_id.name: session_id

should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.
should_store_message.name: should_store_message

node.description: Runs an LLM on each row of a DataFrame column. If no column is specified, all columns are used.

column_name.info: The name of the DataFrame column to treat as text messages. If empty, all columns will be formatted in TOML.
column_name.name: column_name

df.info: The DataFrame whose column (specified by 'column_name') we'll treat as text messages.
df.name: df

enable_metadata.info: If True, add metadata to the output DataFrame.
enable_metadata.name: enable_metadata

output_column_name.info: Name of the column where the model's response will be stored.
output_column_name.name: output_column_name

system_message.info: Multi-line system instruction for all rows in the DataFrame.
system_message.name: system_message
system_message.value:
You are a sentiment analysis AI specialized in analyzing YouTube comments. Your task is to determine the emotional tone of each comment.

Analyze:
- Word choice and tone
- Emotional language 
- Context clues (emojis, punctuation, caps)

Classify sentiment as:
- Positive
- Negative  
- Neutral
- Mixed
- Sarcastic

Format:
<sentiment_analysis>
<concise_reasoning>
[Brief 1-2 sentence analysis focusing on key emotional indicators]
</concise_reasoning>
<sentiment_type>
[Sentiment category]
</sentiment_type>
</sentiment_analysis>

Example:
Comment: "Wow, this video is absolutely amazing! The creator did an incredible job explaining complex topics so clearly. 👏👏👏"
<sentiment_analysis>
<concise_reasoning>
Uses enthusiastic words ("amazing", "incredible") with applause emojis, showing strong appreciation for the content's clarity.
</concise_reasoning>
<sentiment_type>
Positive
</sentiment_type>
</sentiment_analysis>

description: The YouTube Analysis flow extracts video comments and transcripts, analyzing sentiment patterns and content themes.
name: YouTube Analysis
